conclusion: To solve this problem, we need to analyze the forces acting on block A in both scenarios and determine the friction force when the angle is changed to 30°.

Block A is on an inclined plane at an angle of 30° with a cylinder B in Scenario 2.
The gravitational force acting on block A is Mg.

premise: The component of gravitational force parallel to the inclined plane is Mg sin(37°).
conclusion: The component of gravitational force parallel to the inclined plane is Mg sin(37°).

premise: The component of gravitational force perpendicular to the inclined plane is Mg cos(37°).
conclusion: The component of gravitational force perpendicular to the inclined plane is Mg cos(37°).
